deductible.translation[0].definitions[0]: a payment that is taken away from an employee’s pay for a particular purpose before they receive it
Rather than increase premiums for those that choose the medical plan, they will be increasing employees’ deductibles.
deductible.translation[0].definitions[1]: an amount that an insured person has to pay each time they make a CLAIM
You can get insurance for your pet for a premium of $97.50 a year, with a $50 deductible.
deductible.translation[1].definitions[0]: if an amount of money is deductible, you can take it away from the amount you have earned before you calculate how much tax you will have to pay
Only 80% of dining and entertainment costs are deductible as a business expense.
